channel.title: Close - Problem solved
channel.description:
Problem solved by myself ;D
Mods close this if you can, thank you.

item.title: Close - Problem solved
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

okay lets break this down. seys = "say's", em = "them", meh = "me" now you can fix them up. Also I was not using sarcasm, how about you go and learn what it actually means. I was clearly stating that people will respect you more and take you more seriously if you use correct english instead of trying to talk like a gangster.

Do you know how much of a jerk you just made your self sound like? If i wanted to correct your spelling I would tell you that:

A. You did not capitalize the first word of your paragraph.
B. Quotations are not needed when correcting someone(The way you used it to replace my words that is.), they are used to reenact clear words that someone has said such as “english will get you further.” by the way English is a noun there for must be Capitalized, and that quoted sentence is incomplete. Use a noun or an verb to complete it: English will get you further in life, or English will get you your answer faster. One more thing It would be: “seys” = say’s, “em” = them, “meh” = me. Woot ok?
C. You did not start the correction off with a colon (This, :, is a colon)

There’s many more mistakes you have made; however, I will not discriminate you for them. Because I don’t like to correct peoples spelling. Before you correct one’s way of spelling, make sure you know what your doing as well. To be honest WHO FREKING CARES, ITS THE COMPUTER! You’re trying to correct someone’s spelling over the Computer. But let me tell you something just because one is slack on his/her spelling in a game or in some forums doesn’t mean hes/shes not smart, or can’t spell, it means i really don’t give a crap about the way they spell in front of people they don’t know in real life.

No more trollness mmk? By the way! Iz are speekn Lolcat fur yor infomation! don judge meh fuu!

Read full topic

item.title: Close - Problem solved
item.dc:creator: @naughty_jef naughty jef
item.description:
@naughty_jef wrote:

jaloko:

Well title seys it all, where do i remove em. ive looked in sprits and what not. please help meh?? i need to get rid of the torch animation at the log in screen. im making a custom client. thank you XD

okay lets break this down. seys = “say’s”, em = “them”, meh = “me”
now you can fix them up. Also I was not using sarcasm, how about you go and learn what it actually means. I was clearly stating that people will respect you more and take you more seriously if you use correct english instead of trying to talk like a gangster.

Read full topic

item.title: Close - Problem solved
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

Ok i used a script searcher and some other methods and found out its in client.java(so obvious now.) all you have to do is search the things that connect to it which would be Connecting to Fileserver then you look for the start of it: Method51 as show here in this code.

[code][quote=“jaloko, post:1, topic:352031”]Well title seys it all, where do i remove em. ive looked in sprits and what not. please help meh?? i need to get rid of the torch animation at the log in screen. im making a custom client. thank you XD[/quote]

I have found it. If anyone is wondering. in client.java you look up method51 or Connecting to fileserver and delete the javascript:

public final void method51(int i)
{
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_966 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, “titlebox”, 0);
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1291 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(aClass44_1053, “titlebox”, 0);
if(i <= 0)
aBoolean1231 = !aBoolean1231;
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, “titlebutton”, 0);
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1292 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(aClass44_1053, “titlebutton”, 0);
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1152 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[12];
int j = 0;
try
{
j = Integer.parseInt(getParameter(“fl_icon”));
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }
if(j == 0)
{
for(int k = 0; k < 12; k++)
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1152[k] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, “runes”, k);

    } else
    {
        for(int l = 0; l < 12; l++)
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1152[l] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(aClass44_1053, "runes", 1 + (l & 10));

    }

    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1201 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(128, 265);//128
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1202 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(128, 265);

    for(int i1 = 0; i1 < 33920; i1++)
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1201.anIntArray1439[i1] = aClass15_1110.anIntArray315[i1];

    for(int j1 = 0; j1 < 33920; j1++)
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_1202.anIntArray1439[j1] = aClass15_1111.anIntArray315[j1];

    anIntArray851 = new int[256];
    for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 64; k1++)
        anIntArray851[k1] = k1 * 0x40000;

    for(int l1 = 0; l1 < 64; l1++)
        anIntArray851[l1 + 64] = 0xff0000 + 1024 * l1;

    for(int i2 = 0; i2 < 64; i2++)
        anIntArray851[i2 + 128] = 0xffff00 + 4 * i2;

    for(int j2 = 0; j2 < 64; j2++)
        anIntArray851[j2 + 192] = 0xffffff;

    anIntArray852 = new int[256];
    for(int k2 = 0; k2 < 64; k2++)
        anIntArray852[k2] = k2 * 1024;

    for(int l2 = 0; l2 < 64; l2++)
        anIntArray852[l2 + 64] = 65280 + 4 * l2;

    for(int i3 = 0; i3 < 64; i3++)
        anIntArray852[i3 + 128] = 65535 + 0x40000 * i3;

    for(int j3 = 0; j3 < 64; j3++)
        anIntArray852[j3 + 192] = 0xffffff;

    anIntArray853 = new int[256];
    for(int k3 = 0; k3 < 64; k3++)
        anIntArray853[k3] = k3 * 4;

    for(int l3 = 0; l3 < 64; l3++)
        anIntArray853[l3 + 64] = 255 + 0x40000 * l3;

    for(int i4 = 0; i4 < 64; i4++)
        anIntArray853[i4 + 128] = 0xff00ff + 1024 * i4;

    for(int j4 = 0; j4 < 64; j4++)
        anIntArray853[j4 + 192] = 0xffffff;


    anIntArray850 = new int[256];
    anIntArray1190 = new int[32768];
    anIntArray1191 = new int[32768];
    method106(null, -135);
    anIntArray828 = new int[32768];
    anIntArray829 = new int[32768];

    method13(10, (byte)4, "Connecting to fileserver");
    if(!aBoolean831)
    {
        aBoolean880 = true;
        aBoolean831 = true;
        method12(this, 2);
    }
}

[/code]

delete that and you get rid of it XD or just error it by taking away a bracket or deleting “Method51”

item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

It’s kinda self explanatory of what i need. the torches anim. in the login screen is still there and i need to know how to get rid of em(its the client log in screen.)

if you cant help I would appreciate if you dident type anything at all. thank you for your time.
